data.title: Barnett/Rayner Family
data.text:
I recent began researching my family and have come across this infromation on the 1881 census.

RAYNER, John Head Married M 51 1830 Auctioner

Leeds

Yorkshire

RAYNER, Mary A Wife Married F 40 1841

Leeds

Yorkshire

BARNETT, William Wifes Son Single M 23 1858 Boot Finisher

Leeds

Yorkshire

BARNETT, Alice Wifes Daughter Single F 17 1864

Leeds

Yorkshire

On this census John & Mary have their own children as well Charles N 1853, John 1860, Annie 1868, Minnie 1876, Arthur 1879 and Mary 1854.

These two children appear to be born in the middle but with a different surname. Can anyone shed a light on this?

Hi,

1881 England Census

about John Rayner

Name: John Rayner

Age: 51

Estimated Birth Year: abt 1830

Relation: Head

Spouse's Name: Mary A.

Gender: Male

Where born: Leeds, Yorkshire, England

Civil Parish: Leeds

County/Island: Yorkshire

Country: England

Street address: 145 North St

Condition as to marriage: Married

Education:

Employment status: View Image

Occupation: Auctioner

Registration district: Leeds

Sub registration district: West Leeds

ED, institution, or vessel: 2

Neighbors: View others on page

Household Members: Name Age

Alice Barnett 17 (daughter in law)

William Barnett 23 (stepson)

Charles N. Rayner 28

John Rayner 51

John Rayner 21

Mary A. Rayner 40

Annie Reyner 13

Arthur Reyner 2

Minnie Reyner 5

Mary Walker 27

Tom Walker 1

Deex

Are these 3 children from John and Marys marriage;

Annie Reyner 13

Arthur Reyner 2

Minnie Reyner 5

Maybe they were both married before.

I am unsure. I believe they were from John & Mary's married with there being only one letter difference in the names/

Possible??

1861 England Census

about William Barnett

Name: William Barnett

Age: 3

Estimated Birth Year: abt 1858

Relation: Son

Father's Name: Samuel

Mother's Name: Mary Ann

Gender: Male

Where born: Leeds, Yorkshire, England

Civil Parish: Leeds

Ecclesiastical parish: All Saints

Town: Leeds

County/Island: Yorkshire

Country: England

Street address:

Occupation:

Condition as to marriage: View Image

Registration district: Leeds

Sub registration district: South East Leeds

ED, institution, or vessel: 26

Neighbors: View others on page

Household schedule number: 79

Household Members: Name Age

Mary Ann Barnett 22

Samuel Barnett 26

William Barnett 3

in 1852 John & Mary were married...they lived in Haymont Street

They were married 21.06.1852 at Leeds Registry office. Is it possible they seperated?

At all of the following addresses

1861 - 15 Haymount Street

1871 - 1 Violet Street

1881 - 145 North Street

Having looked a little more i think he did marry twice..and had Minnie and Arthur. While Mary also married twice having Alice and Hannah...

Is it possible his second wife was also called Mary as when his children by wife number 2 were born, in 1881 he was living with a Mary...same name as his first wife??

There are also two more children, Jane and Catherine born 1858 and 1856.

What I current have is:

Mary Nicholson & Samuel Barnett married ??

Two children

William 1858

Alice 1864

Mary Nicholson & John Reynar

Married 21.05.1852

Children:

Charles Rayner 1852

Mary Rayner 1853

Catherine Rayner 1858

John Rayner 1860

Annie Rayner 1868

Jane Rayner 1856

John Rayner & unknown wife

Children:

Minnie Reyner 1876

Arthur Reyner 1879

Can anyone help me find out the name of John's first wife? And maybe give me some ideas to why the children were all born as if during a bizzare 4 way marriage
